tweets.text: W COUNTRY SAT-SUN The @metoffice Amber Warning for heavy rain, covering from midday Sat to 6am Sun, has just been extended eastwards (so now covers all of #Gloucestershire & #Wiltshire). Surface & river flooding impacts are likely. Keep across @EnvAgencySW @EnvAgencyMids updates https://t.co/ZYdIXdOiyo

We‚Äôve been notified by Thames Water that they are discharging a mix of rainwater and sewage into the Chess from the Chesham Sewage Treatment Works. Please stay out of the water downstream of Blackwell Hall Lane. This is how the river looks during a discharge: https://t.co/p2NmZhpimL

domain.name: Interests and Hobbies Vertical
domain.description: Top level interests and hobbies groupings, like Food or Travel

domain.name: Interests and Hobbies Category
domain.description: A grouping of interests and hobbies entities, like Novelty Food or Destinations

domain.name: Interests and Hobbies
domain.description: Interests, opinions, and behaviors of individuals, groups, or cultures; like Speciality Cooking or Theme Parks

entity.name: Traditional games
entity.description: Traditional tabletop games like poker, chess, and mahjong.

tweets.text: Environment Agency officers are currently in attendance at a fire at a scrapyard in Pocklington, working with @HumbersideFire. https://t.co/V43CTVBPtJ

Flood alerts and warnings out in the south due to #StormAlex. In Yorks & North East, rain expected to continue throughout today and tomorrow. Check your flood risk and sign up to our free flood warning service: https://t.co/xADRoYQTUa https://t.co/F3jhn06gmR

Stay up to date on flood risk across the country this weekend. You can check flood warnings for free here (updated every 15 minutes). ‚Ä¶https://t.co/JhazgqcQ60. Guideance on what @EnvAgency's flood warnings mean below ‚§µÔ∏è https://t.co/qB9VDqqZ0y

Was a great moment to watch this yesterday - moments where the progress is obvious are always a highlight of working on projects like this! 
@The_RRC @Trent_R_Trust @EnvAgencyMids #conservationist #riverrestoration #staffsSUNRISE https://t.co/QVQ3sfgZoa

11.25am, Saturday

The latest summary of potential #flooding shows areas of concerns in amber - you might call it orange - or yellow...

In any event, flooding POSSIBLE or PROBABLE in the next few days...

Full details: https://t.co/qwCZ0xXJ1Y or via Floodline: 0345 988 1188... https://t.co/Nj85Jzjg1Q

10:40am, Saturday

Flood alerts in #Surrey, around #Guildford and #Farnham... 

...on the border with #WestSussex: #Horley, #Gatwick and #Crawley... 

Flooding POSSIBLE in both areas...  

Full details: https://t.co/y2l94AYyu8, or from Floodline: 0345 988 1188 #floodaware https://t.co/rDz1XHHmkQ

10:50am, Saturday

Flood alerts around the northern half of the #M25... 

Flooding POSSIBLE in places like #Harrow, #Hillingdon, #WalthamAbbey, #Edmonton and #ChadwellHeath...  

Full details: https://t.co/y2l94AYyu8, or from Floodline: 0345 988 1188 #floodaware https://t.co/tLYxqqPYlV
With heavy rain likely it wouldn't harm to check your flood risk once or twice today. Takes less than a minute - https://t.co/QdPKdEYx15 #StormAlex https://t.co/cg4AKmftir https://t.co/ukuPhu6y9N

Join us on the 4th December to discuss #Flood and #CoastalErosion risk management? Speakers include @EmmaHowardBoyd @EnvAgency @floodre @simonpic78 @InnesThomson @NatFloodForum @fayflood @AECOM @DrFox_Tim & @unitedutilities
Click here to find out more: https://t.co/Msdd1q2YRA https://t.co/oLHNU00BIi

urls.title: Find out if you're at risk of flooding in England
urls.description: Check your risk of flooding: get current flood warnings, check the 5-day forecast or use flood maps

tweets.text: Our field teams are working hard checking flood defences and clearing screens in preparation for heavy rain and high winds this weekend that could cause localised flooding. Be prepared. Check https://t.co/G0SjP0XBX4 or call Floodline on 0345 988 1188 for the latest flood updates.
Good to see @BBCNews running my piece on how polluted #Somerset's rivers have become, according to @EnvAgencySW - and what @pow_rebecca is doing about it: https://t.co/BvU4243xcu #LDReporter

tweets.text:
11am, Saturday

Flooding expected around #Swanage in #Dorset...

Please be careful along beaches, promenades and coastal footpaths and roads as large waves could be dangerous...  

Full details: https://t.co/y2l94AYyu8, or from Floodline: 0345 988 1188 #floodaware https://t.co/Qrg3rRyEzU

10:35am, Saturday

Flood alerts in west, south-west, south and south-east London and north #Surrey: flooding POSSIBLE... 

...including #Putney, #Teddington, #Wandsworth, #Croydon, #Dartford  

Full details: https://t.co/y2l94AYyu8, or from Floodline: 0345 988 1188 #floodaware https://t.co/ZfhdBygBJj

It was great to meet Andy and Keith from the @EnvAgencyNW in Padiham earlier today to talk about the much needed flood defences. 
Lots of work is going on now to prepare everything, ready for main work to start next year. And completion is on track for November 2022! https://t.co/Mpy7PNZelX
@tveitdal @Feargal_Sharkey @FT @NorthumbrianH2O And this one ....... https://t.co/5TRtiiLfBd üôÑso we pay huge water bills but can‚Äôt use the service when it rains...... in October.......‚òîÔ∏è

tweets.text:
10:25am, Saturday

Flood alerts in #Kent: flooding POSSIBLE between #Hadlow and #EastPeckham, near #Tonbridge... 

...and on the #IsleofSheppey and from #Kemsley to #Seasalter

The latest here: https://t.co/y2l94AYyu8, or from Floodline: 0345 988 1188 #floodaware https://t.co/nAysleujuC
Interested to know who is on the new sewage storm overflow task force from the eNGO sector?? Anyone know? ‚Å¶@WCL_News‚Å© ‚Å¶@EnvAgency‚Å©  https://t.co/W0fIKzWBJY

urls.title: Flood warnings for England - GOV.UK
urls.description: Check your risk of flooding: get current flood warnings, river and sea levels, check the 5-day forecast or use flood risk maps

urls.title: Dealing with extreme weather - West Sussex County Council
urls.description: Information and advice about dealing with flooding, heatwave, snow and ice.

tweets.text: Flood Alerts have been issued by @EnvAgency for details go to https://t.co/67RDvsSGM6. Please take care of yourself, family and neighbours, especially if elderly or vulnerable. See the WSCC website for advice on keeping safe and well: https://t.co/LOkybEdaaB https://t.co/OlY2J4CXlG

@EnvAgencySE Please use the sluice gate and do this on the Cray river way behind Crayford Way. The sluice gate never seems to be used and we haven‚Äôt seen anyone taking care of our river for so long and it‚Äôs our house that will flood. https://t.co/8QnaVP3f5p

One of the frequent ways we prevent flooding ahead of storms is make sure rivers are clear of blockages and flowing nicely...

Like here today in #Surrey ‚¨áÔ∏è... but not just Surrey; our teams are doing this work across the country #floodaware #StormAlex https://t.co/KSPvb62m6V

Today two @EnvAgency field operations officers from our Cramlington depot cleared parts of the River Don at West Boldon in preparation for the forecast bad weather by #StormAlex and to their surprise they fished out 18 shopping trolleys which were returned to @asda #Boldon https://t.co/WxRtfZv2QY

tweets.text:
With heavy rain forecast its important that you are prepared and have a plan in place in case #flooding occurs.

Stay safe and sign up for flood alerts üëâhttps://t.co/CMfTIXUuR8

 #PrepareActSurvive #Floods #Flooding https://t.co/p0OgQeXB5I

London‚Äôs air quality has dramatically improved. Data shows a 97% decrease in the number of schools in areas with illegal levels of pollution.
 
I'm delighted with our progress, but there's still a long way to go. That‚Äôs why I‚Äôm expanding ULEZ in 2021. https://t.co/Kfl83wcT6q

tweets.text:
More stormy and persistent rain is expected this weekend across parts of England.

Stay safe and sign up for flood alerts: https://t.co/P5d6Ax7xwQ

 #Floods #Flooding https://t.co/3YfkRdZjwe

Another day another @EnvAgency failure.

Four out of nine water companies in England are now rated as poor when it comes to pollution, the worst result since 2011.

For how much longer I wonder will @MPGeorgeEustice tolerate the incompetence?

https://t.co/X05iHf0Lxu

@AndyDevanney @antony_hig @EnvAgencyNW @AndynBrown16 @DefraGovUK remember it well. Current Tory leader actually had plenty to say about it before voting against it too. Shame the meetings weren't streamed live then, but his against vote is firmly on record!
@berringtonblac1 @EnvAgencyAnglia @CRTBoating HI, 3 miles north of Earith, near the causeway to Aldreth..

Just 6 months after admitting to 8,400 pollution incidents in court @SouthernWater still manage to top the 2019 polluter in chief scoreboard.

What's clear is the @EnvAgency has no control over this company and even clearer, it is now time for @Ofwat to revoke SW's licence. https://t.co/1KqXjd6XYE
@NBBertie1 @EnvAgencyAnglia @CRTBoating wow, that's deep. Whereabouts is it?

As Area Duty Manager, the incident duty team are busy monitoring and planning for Storm Alex. We have extra field staff on the ground checking assets and clearing trash screens etc. @EnvAgencySW https://t.co/hKQHEWm5QE
Fen life....@EnvAgencyAnglia @CRTBoating https://t.co/SZsh5zyA41

urls.title: Levels of Somerset river pollution 'absolutely terrifying'
urls.description: Tests of Somerset's rivers found mercury, lead, insecticides and flame-retardant compounds present.

tweets.text:
As a little contrast everyday water companies leak 2,954,000,000 litres of water from their underinvested, under repaired, faulty, leaky pipes.

Yep that's 1,078,210,000,000 litres of water per year stolen from our rivers.

And the @EnvAgency does what exactly? https://t.co/RkJP0KAsoX
